content:
Enable users to only select one child card from all child cards across multiple parents with the Select Cards action and the resetselectedcards event. Users can reset just the child cards across multiple parents, or reset all child cards and selectable parent cards as well.

This feature extends the Select Cards action. See Let Users Update an OmniScript by Selecting Records on a FlexCard.

EXAMPLE: SCHEDULE AN APPOINTMENT

YOU WANT TO CREATE A FLEXCARD THAT ENABLES HEALTHCARE CUSTOMERS TO SCHEDULE THEIR OWN APPOINTMENTS.

CREATE A PARENT FLEXCARD THAT LISTS ALL AVAILABLE PROVIDERS. EMBED A CHILD FLEXCARD THAT LISTS THE PROVIDER'S AVAILABLE APPOINTMENTS.

IN THE CHILD FLEXCARD, ADD AN ACTIONABLE ELEMENT THAT EXECUTES SEQUENTIAL ACTIONS THAT TRIGGERS A PUBSUB EVENT FOLLOWED BY A CUSTOM EVENT. FROM THE PUBSUB EVENT, CREATE A LISTENER THAT DESELECTS ALL SELECTED CHILD CARDS. TO SELECT A NEW CHILD CARD, CREATE ANOTHER CUSTOM EVENT AND HAVE IT FIRE WHEN THE USER CLICKS ON THE NEW APPOINTMENT.

TO CLEAR SELECTED CHILD CARDS, CREATE AN ACTION TO TRIGGER THE EVENT THAT DESELECTS ALL SELECTED CHILD CARDS. FOR EXAMPLE, CLEAR ALL SELECTED APPOINTMENTS ACROSS ALL HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS.

To create the event listener that listens for this event, click + Add New in the Event Listener section of the Setup panel and perform the following tasks:

Enter the same values for Event Type, Channel Name, and Event Name from the previous steps.

Under Actions, create a custom event action whose Event Name is resetselectedcards.

To reset child cards across all parents, select Bubbles, and confirm Composed is not selected.

Click Save.

To create a subsequent action that selects a new child card, perform the following tasks on the same actionable element from step 3:

Select + Add New in the Actions section of the Properties panel to create a sequential action. See Trigger Sequential Actions on an Actionable Element on a FlexCard.

Select Event as the Action Type and Custom as the Event Type.

Enter the Event Name such as selectappt.

Select Bubbles and confirm Composed is not selected

To configure other properties for the Select Cards action, see Let Users Update an OmniScript by Selecting Records on a FlexCard.

TO ACTIVATE THE FLEXCARD, CREATE OR OPEN A PARENT FLEXCARD AND DRAG THE FLEXCARD ELEMENT FROM THE BUILD PANEL ONTO THE CANVAS. CLICK INTO FLEXCARD NAME AND SELECT THE CHILD FLEXCARD CREATED IN STEP 1.

Create or open a parent FlexCard and drag the FlexCard element from the Build panel onto the canvas.
Click into FlexCard Name and select the child FlexCard created in step 1.
To preview and test your FlexCard before publishing, click the Preview tab.
title: Selecting Single Child Cards Across Multiple Parents on FlexCards
